metadata.title: CVE-2022-3646 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, has been found inLinux Kernel. This issue affects the function nilfs_attach_log_writer ofthe file fs/nilfs2/segment.c of the component BPF. The manipulation leadsto memory leak. The attack may be initiated remotely. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-211961 was assigned tothis vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-gcp - 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-oracle - 4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
